elements.title: Rosalie Edge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American environmentalist Rosalie Edge (pictured) was called "the only honest, unselfish, indomitable hellcat in the history of conservation"?

elements.title: Iron-grass Natural Temperate Grassland of South Australia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the dominant species in the Iron-grass Natural Temperate Grassland of South Australia are often not grasses at all?

elements.title: Mercy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a pink skin for Mercy in the video game Overwatch helped raise more than $12 million for breast cancer research?

elements.title: Philippine embassy in Paris (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2005, the Philippine embassy in Paris regularly had a flooded basement due to a lack of funds?

elements.title: Edward Rand (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that medievalist Edward Rand rang the doorbell of Harvard president Charles William Eliot and asked him: "I would like to go to Harvard; do you have any money?"

elements.title: Capital in the Anthropocene (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that academic Kohei Saito describes the Sustainable Development Goals as the "new opium of the masses" in his 2020 Marxist book, Capital in the Anthropocene?

elements.title: Nick Kerbawy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nick Kerbawy did not receive his college tennis championship trophy until 14 years after winning it?

elements.title: Ardress House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the dining room at Ardress House has no internal doors and can only be reached using an external entrance?
